intro: Eriospermum rautanenii, commonly known as the Rautanen's eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in summer. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Eriospermum rautanenii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
